questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : PROGRAMMING IN C (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: Select all the correct statements from the below.
question_texts: Select all the correct statements from the below.

options.option_text: Registers are the memory closest to the CPU
Cache can be used to store data that is not frequently accessed.
Main memory is faster than cache memory.
Main memory is slower than the registers.

questions.question_text_1: Select all the valid variable names in C.
question_texts: Select all the valid variable names in C.

questions.question_text_1:
Find the Hexadecimal representation of the word "FAX” in ASCII.  
Hint: A - 65(decimal), B - 66, … in ASCII.
question_texts:
Find the Hexadecimal representation of the word "FAX” in ASCII.  
Hint: A - 65(decimal), B - 66, … in ASCII.

questions.question_text_1: Convert the hexadecimal number 0xAC73 to its equivalent binary representation.
question_texts: Convert the hexadecimal number 0xAC73 to its equivalent binary representation.

questions.question_text_1: Find the minimum number of bits required to represent an instruction set where there are 8 unique instructions and each instruction can take at most 2 operands.  Assume the first operand should be able to represent 64 registers and the second operand should be able to represent -127 to 127 in signed magnitude form.
question_texts: Find the minimum number of bits required to represent an instruction set where there are 8 unique instructions and each instruction can take at most 2 operands.  Assume the first operand should be able to represent 64 registers and the second operand should be able to represent -127 to 127 in signed magnitude form.
